main event: A sighting of a star-like object, white in color, moving erratically and accompanied by a deep roaring noise in Long Island, New York in 1957, which was concluded to be a meteor.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a pea and was making erratic movements.
Several people witnessed objects 2 to 3 times the size of stars, appearing to be stationary and then fading out of sight.
There were reports of a deep roaring noise accompanying the light from the object.
Weather balloon release as an explanation was considered but eliminated as the cause of the sighting.
The sighting was observed both on ground-radar and ground-visual, providing multiple perspectives on the event.
